placesToVisit.description: Visit Tokyo's oldest temple, a vibrant and popular Buddhist temple in the heart of Asakusa.
Experience the world's busiest intersection, a dazzling example of organized chaos and modern Tokyo.
Explore a bustling market filled with fresh seafood, street food, and culinary treasures.
An iconic arch-monument overlooking the Arabian Sea, a symbol of the city.
Stroll along this scenic promenade, also known as the Queen's Necklace, for beautiful coastal views.
Take a ferry to this UNESCO World Heritage site to see ancient cave temples dedicated to the Hindu god Shiva.
Explore the magnificent imperial palace, the political and ceremonial center of China for over 500 years.
Visit a section of this incredible man-made wonder, stretching thousands of kilometers.
A masterpiece of architecture and landscape design where emperors prayed for good harvests.
Ascend the world's tallest building for breathtaking views of the city and surrounding desert.
Shop at one of the world's largest shopping malls, which also features an aquarium and an ice rink.
Watch a spectacular choreographed fountain show at the base of the Burj Khalifa.
A stunning complex of buildings that served as the official residence of the Kings of Siam.
Known as the Temple of Dawn, this riverside temple is one of Thailand's most famous landmarks.
Home to the giant reclining Buddha, this temple is a must-see for its impressive scale and beauty.
